Heartbreak is the theme in Ramsay Street this week.

Jack and Paige’s indiscretion comes out this week, which has huge consequences for both Steph and Mark. There was no way they were going to get away with that without hurting someone.

Rafael manages to bag himself a date with David, but does a cruel cut and run when he learns a truth about David he doesn’t want to hear, leaving David devastated.

A double elimination looms over the contestants in tonight’s Dancing on Ice and with all of the pressure one couple is going to heat up the competition and pull out all the stops by performing the first ‘head banger’ of the series.

In an attempt to avoid leaving the show, show bosses have teased they will throw everything into their act and perform one of the most infamous, and scary, lifts.

Bosses have teased the dangerous manoeuvre, but have not yet revealed the names of the couple who will be performing the move.

It’s won a legion of fans around the world since it was launched in 2016, combining an epic fantasy adventure with plenty of blood and gore.

And now fans of Square Enix’s dark fantasy series Goblin Slayer will no doubt be elated that the series will be getting the small screen treatment with an anime series.

Announced yesterday, studio White Fox will be bringing to life the adventures of Goblin Slayer as he takes the young and naive Priestess under his wing whilst attempting to kill any and all goblins (the hint is in the name).

Top Gear is about to launch a new series and a ‘new direction’, but Matt LeBlanc has said that another thing that will change is the presenters’ respect for other countries.

The former Friends star, 50, is now heading up the current presenting trio, which also includes Chris Harris and Rory Reid.

But he took a thinly veiled swipe at the show’s previous format as he said it was ‘not our thing’ to take swipes at countries that the trio are visiting.

In other words, they’re keeping it… Read the full story]]> http://metro.co.uk/2018/02/18/top-gears-matt-leblanc-says-presenters-wont-insult-countries-in-new-series-its-not-our-thing-7322055/feed/ 0 Joe Gamp Joe Gamp matt-le-blanc-top-gear josephgamp Top Gear’s Matt LeBlanc teases new direction as show ‘expands into comedy’ Top Gear series 25 Paddy McGuinness endures awkward Keith Lemon sketch about failed marriage on Through The Keyhole http://metro.co.uk/2018/02/18/paddy-mcguinness-endures-awkward-keith-lemon-sketch-about-failed-marriage-on-through-the-keyhole-7321747/ http://metro.co.uk/2018/02/18/paddy-mcguinness-endures-awkward-keith-lemon-sketch-about-failed-marriage-on-through-the-keyhole-7321747/#respond Sun, 18 Feb 2018 11:09:06 +0000 http://metro.co.uk/?p=7321747

Paddy McGuinness may have been feeling some pressure after appearing on Saturday’s episode of Through The Keyhole when he had to sit through a sketch about a camera man splitting up from his wife.

Not awkward at all.

The sketch showed Keith Lemon counselling one of his filming team, Dennis, who in the sketch was having marriage woes as ‘his wife was leaving him’

Soundman Dennis, who was introduced with the tag line ‘can’t stop crying at work’, looked sad on the show as he confided in Lemon during the comedy skit.

Brooke Vincent says Dancing On Ice is tougher than filming a live episode of Coronation Street because she’s more used to things going wrong on the soap.

Brooke has done two live episodes of Corrie and says ice-skating is definitely ‘the scarier thing’.

The 25-year-old, who plays Sophie Webster on the soap, said: ‘In week one we got into a situation we weren’t supposed to be in; if that had been at Corrie, I would have known exactly what to do and would have carried on going.

‘I’ve been brought up there, I know where the cameras are, what… Read the full story]]> http://metro.co.uk/2018/02/18/brooke-vincent-says-dancing-on-ice-is-tougher-than-filming-coronation-streets-live-episodes-7319310/feed/ 0 Sarah Deen Brooke Vincent sarahdeenukmetro Brooke Vincent vows to win Dancing On Ice for ‘girls who aren’t girly’ http://metro.co.uk/2018/02/18/brooke-vincent-vows-to-win-dancing-on-ice-for-girls-who-arent-girly-7319064/ http://metro.co.uk/2018/02/18/brooke-vincent-vows-to-win-dancing-on-ice-for-girls-who-arent-girly-7319064/#respond Sun, 18 Feb 2018 00:01:34 +0000 http://metro.co.uk/?p=7319064

Coronation Street star Brooke Vincent is determined to win Dancing On Ice for girls who aren’t ‘girly’.

The actress is hoping to win the new series of the ice-skating competition with her partner Matej Silecky.

Brooke, 25, is one of two female finalists left and wants to represent ‘normal girls’ by going all the way.

She said: ‘I want to do it for the girls. I really do. I want to do it for the girls that aren’t the girly girls.

‘I’m a normal girl, I don’t wear make up every day, I do look rough. Martin Fowler is about to fall into a dangerous trap in EastEnders as mysterious newcomer Hayley makes her move on him and strikes up a flirty conversation – but who is she and what are her intentions towards him? 

Fans already are well aware from a phone call that Hayley is out to get Martin on behalf of someone else. She previously took pictures of him and didn’t hold back in her criticism of him. She also made it clear what the next stage of her plan was.

Milo Entwistle has become a staple of the Cunningham family in Hollyoaks but little do they know the real reason of why he has attached himself so fiercely to the clan. Viewers are aware that Milo was the driver of the van which hit Gordon and Helen’s car and killed them all those years ago – and he has been trying to repent ever since.

It was an emotional night for the boys on Survival Of The Fittest as Ryan Cleary became the first lad to be kicked out by the girls.

Ryan was one of three boys to get the lowest amount of public votes along with James Middleton and David Lundy.

After some deliberation the girls decided to give Ryan the heave-ho, meaning his time on the show had come to an end.

Ryan said: ‘I’m gonna miss them guys to death, they helped me get through each day. We’re gonna keep in touch on the outside.’

Stacey Johnson, who was convicted of the murder of Carol Heath in 1993, is awaiting his execution in Arkansas – but he swears he didn’t commit the crime.

Heath was 25-years-old when she was found strangled and beaten with her throat slit in her apartment in De Queen, Arkansas.

Johnson was first convicted based on evidence from the victim’s then six-year-old daughter Ashley, however this was reversed as the daughter was found not mentally competent. There were some terrible excuses for Steve’s demise, such as a problem with his diamonte jacket, and one woman who claimed she was ‘allergic to hay’.

Warren’s birthday comes to a sour end after he falls out with Georgia on Survival Of The Fittest.

In scenes to air tonight, Warren is happy to be marking his 30th birthday with the rest of the boys and girls in The Lodge.

The group play a party game where people have to pick questions out of a bowl and read them out, which was never going to end well.

Some of the questions include ‘Three reasons why your team is going to win’ and ‘Three people you would replace.’

The BBC’s new epic Troy: Fall Of A City will be a familiar story to fans of Greek mythology, or at least those who know the story of the Trojan horse. Those who aren’t familiar with either will enjoy this great bit of Saturday night entertainment in a similar vein to Game Of Thrones or Vikings.

The plot is sweeping and involves many characters from various families so it might be tricky to keep up with everyone’s motivations or where their allegiances lie – but if a certain HBO show could manage it for eight seasons…

RuPaul’s Drag Race All Stars 3 episode four saw the elimination of Chi Chi Devayne, with both BenDeLaCreme and Shangela choosing her to go home after the two queens were given the power to send someone home.

How to stream and watch online http://metro.co.uk/2018/02/17/where-can-i-watch-peaky-blinders-season-4-how-to-stream-and-watch-online-7320447/ http://metro.co.uk/2018/02/17/where-can-i-watch-peaky-blinders-season-4-how-to-stream-and-watch-online-7320447/#respond Sat, 17 Feb 2018 14:20:15 +0000 http://metro.co.uk/?p=7320447

Peaky Blinders has grown phenomenally over the past years with viewers eagerly anticipating the release of season five.

The BBC Two Cillian Murphy drama has surged in popularity with each series and season four was no exception.

Adrien Brody, Tom Hardy and Charlotte Riley have all taken part in a fantastic all-star cast.
